text: Josef Schediwy ( 7 December 1882 - 14 September 1915 in Tashkent) Rapid Archivwas an Austrian football player. He played for SK Rapid Wien and the Austrian national football team. ==Career== With Rapid he won the first Austrian championship in 1911/12. Schediwy was one of the older players at this time and was rarely used. He still contributed three goals in three games in this season to help Rapid win their first championship title. Schediwy was able to defend the title with the team and played two games in the championship. In the 1913/14 season he played his matches for the Rapid and reached second place. ==International== He played his first match for the Austrian national football team on 11 October 1903 versus Hungary.The game was originally played as a city game (official Name of the Austrian team: Team of the Football Union) and only recognized as an international game years later. His last match was on 1 June 1909 versus England.Ã–FB players profil ==Death== On 14 September 1915, Josef Schediwy died as a Russian prisoner of war in Tashkent. ==Honours== 2x Austrian champion: 1912, 1913 ==References== Category:Austrian footballers Category:Players of the Austrian national football team Category:1882 births Category:1915 deaths Category:Austrian football forwards Category:Austrian football champions
title: Josef Schediwy
